title: FS: T200 Fatima Cleveland Americans w/ Joe Jackson
author: Tyler

posts.post_title: FS: T200 Fatima Cleveland Americans w/ Joe Jackson
posts.post_content:
Beautiful example of the T200 Fatima Cleveland Americans, graded Authentic by SGC.  Affordable way to obtain a clean specimen that features the immortal "Shoeless" Joe Jackson.  Back is clean, photo can be emailed upon request.

$300.00 or best offer

Please email me at [url]tilercox@aol.com[/url] if interested.

Thanks,
Tyler

[URL="http://s210.photobucket.com/albums/bb189/Tyjaycox/?action=view&current=T200ClevelandShoelessJoeSGCA.jpg"][IMG]http://i210.photobucket.com/albums/bb189/Tyjaycox/T200ClevelandShoelessJoeSGCA.jpg[/IMG][/URL]

I just assumed the card was deemed to be trimmed.  

After I saw your question I went to oldcardboard.com to see what the dimensions were supposed to be.  They say 2 5/8" x 4 3/4".  

This card actually measures 2 5/8" x 4 13/16".  A little bigger than they say it is supposed to be.  

Back is clean, not sure why it was deemed authentic, as I can't see any other issues.

[quote name="Tyler" post=972031]I just assumed the card was deemed to be trimmed.  
After I saw your question I went to oldcardboard.com to see what the dimensions were supposed to be.  They say 2 5/8" x 4 3/4".  
This card actually measures 2 5/8" x 4 13/16".  A little bigger than they say it is supposed to be.  
Back is clean, not sure why it was deemed authentic, as I can't see any other issues.[/QUOTE]

I asked a similar question to this about my tiger t200 that appears very o/c and measures larger than standard.  Theory goes, it was corner card on the sheet and oversized cards were fairly regular with the position on the sheet.  My card measures 2 3/4" x 4 7/8" and my short-sided borders appear a tad thicker than this card.  Id post a scan, but the scanner is down at the moment.  Id guess Tyler is correct with the trim.  Nice card and if I werent after these CJs, Id probably take you up on it.

Doesn't looked trimmed to me.  Just factory miscut.

Nice card.

I really wish that grading companies would get their act together and grade everything with the same conviction. At this point I don't trust any grade! only reason I still get things graded is for the slabs.. they are super convenient.
